intro: Panke caulescens, commonly known as the slender panke, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and simple, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Panke caulescens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
